alert.note: Alert for Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 05 at 10:50AM EDT until September 05 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Rabun County in northeastern Georgia... Northwestern Oconee County in upstate South Carolina... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 1050 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated repeated showers and embedded thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen over the past six hours. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by showers and thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clayton, Tiger, Tallulah Falls, Lakemont, Lake Rabun, Long Creek, Pine Mountain, Mountain Rest and Seed Lake. Flooding has developed along Ramey Road near Lakemont. Flooding will also likely develop along Stekoa Creek and Tiger Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
